ad_creative_bodies:
My mate is rejecting me after taking my V card.
"I, William Montgomery, the future alpha of the Glomarian Wood Pack, reject you as my mate and future Luna...." I know this coming. I sense it.
 "What, you won't accept my rejection, now?" William continued,
"Actually, I can consider accepting you as my mate but with some conditions-" he smiled.
But I snapped. "I, Mytira, accept your rejection, William Montgomery." 
I needed to leave, but I stopped and threw out one last remark.
"And if ever you have the opportunity to take me, I won't hesitate to rip out your throat. I will always have my pride, William Montgomery. 

Chapter 1
Mytira's POV. 

They call me 'dungeon girl'. 

It's a nickname that has stuck with me as I grew up in the stifling cell that my mother had occupied.

My mom had been detained twenty years ago when I was still a fetus. I was born and raised in the dungeon, and at the age of five, my mom suddenly became mute. She no longer wanted to speak and only used sign language, and somehow, I was convinced that she wasn't mute; I believed that something horrible had happened to her. 

*

Unlike my mother, who had to spend the rest of her life in that cell, I was allowed to go out from morning till night.

My freedom had its own catch. I wasn't out to have a blast or enjoy my days like any other young wolflings. No, my purpose was far from joyful. I was out from the crack of dawn to the stroke of midnight to become a servant in the grand Alpha Montgomery pack house to serve Alpha's family ; our obnoxious Luna, Delicy Montgomery, and his arrogant spoiled brat's son, William Montgomery.

William was the same age as me.
But William is rarely home because he spends more time in military training. Rumor has it that today, he already came home to attend the mate search party that will be held later tonight. 

In Glomarian Woods Pack, he is the embodiment of all that is desirable and admirable. 

His features were a portrait of perfection - a handsome face framed by wavy golden hair that flowed effortlessly, partially covering his face. His eyes, like the color of the blue sky on a bright summer's day, had a mesmerizing that captivated everyone who dared to look into them. The intensity of his gaze, coupled with his well-defined eyebrows, had a magnetic allure that drew in every onlooker, entangling them in his charm.

To be honest, I was also attracted to him. But I wouldn't say I like his personality. He is a copycat of his mother's behavior. A Luna who doesn't behave like a Luna who should be a 'mother' to the pack members but instead likes to bully and do whatever she wants to us, a lowly members. A good-for-nothing Luna with an equally good-for-nothing son.

It's just perfect. 

**

Tonight, there will be a big party for the mate search of the young wolflings of the Alpha and Beta. And today was more exciting because it was my birthday, and Luna Delicy had allowed me to attend the mate-seeking event at the Pack Palace ballroom. She said it was a present for my birthday. 

"Remember, you can only stand in the outer tent, and you are strictly forbidden to enter the party!" So said the butler, and I nodded, indicating that I understood the rules of the game.

We, the omegas, were forbidden to mingle with the royal and upper-class wolves, and we could only be spectators during the event.

I understood that; I know my place.

After all, Luna Delicy had always emphasized that it was impossible for an omega to be paired with a high-class wolf like an alpha or beta. 

And our destiny was to be servants and slaves... forever.

As I arrived in front of the ballroom, my eyes were hypnotized by its magnificence. The splendor of the room was breathtaking, a sight to behold. However, as much as I wanted to be a part of it all, I knew deep down that it wasn't meant for someone like me.

"Hey, omega maid! You are not allowed to get in. Get out of here!"

The guard hurriedly pulled me away from the enchanting sight, guiding me to the designated spot. He threw a sharp glare at me, a stern warning drawn in his eyes.

"This is where you belong," he whispered as he chuckled mockingly.

"Never dream of setting foot in that hall. It is reserved only for the nobles and alpha families, a world beyond our reach."

"I know," I replied to him sternly.

"You don't have to remind me," I said as I scanned my surroundings to find a place to sit.

I know.

I really... really understand that this world is unfair. 

We, the omegas, are the lowest caste in werewolves world. We used to live off their scraps while they sat on their plush cushions and had fun without a care in the world.

If anything, I envy them for their easy lives and privileges from birth. Even they will remain there because the alphas will only mate with fellow alphas, and we omegas have no chance to raise our caste through marriage.

We have been forced to give up any possibility of belonging to them. Now, we have nothing left but to serve our alpha bloodline masters. Our fate was sealed the moment we were born, and I think that's why we are so dependent on the alphas. They were the only ones who would give us everything we needed to survive.

I had just sat down in the chair provided there when suddenly someone came calling my name.

"Mytira!!" The words split the air, sharp and urgent. My gaze shifted to the man with the curved thick mustache, his eyes sharp and intense.

"Yes?" I answered cautiously, a hesitation lacing my voice.

"We are short of servants at this party, and the butler requests you to come and help us," the man explained gruffly, his impatience evident as he pulled me from my seat, leading me quickly towards the grand ballroom through a hidden side door. Just as my feet stepped into the ballroom, I felt a sudden change of atmosphere envelop me.

Something that was scented with pine and musk, engulfing me like an invisible mist, intoxicating my senses with its mesmerizing allure. It was as if the essence of the forest had been distilled into one seductive scent, awakening something primal in me.

"Mate..." A velvety voice whispered, so close it felt like a breath in my ear, sending chills down my spine.

The primitive call of my wolf surged through my veins.

"Mate, our mate is here, Mytira..." My wolf's voice echoed in the depths of my mind. I was stunned and froze at my place. 

In that moment of awareness, my gaze swept across the room, drawn towards a figure I knew all too well, William Montgomery, the only son of the Alpha Montgomery.

He is the future alpha of this Glomarian Woods Pack, he stood there and glared at me. 

I could see a storm of emotions roiling beneath the surface as his fists clenched in barely contained rage. And he strolled over to me with swift steps as he saw me frozen, staring at him from a distance.

"William..." I hissed softly, realization dawning as I traced the source of the musky and pine-scented attraction that had ensnared my senses.

Chapter 2
Mytira's POV

"What the shet is this?" William screeched rudely at me as he towered before me. 

For a few seconds straight, I had been frozen when I realized the scent I smelled earlier; my mate's scent was his, the Alpha's son.

"This can't be, this must be a joke!" He was getting more and more aggravated, while I just shrank and didn't dare to say a word. I could see his anger mixed with disgust.

"I wish that too," I said softly. No, this was not what I wanted.

"What?!" He screamed.

William's shout at me only made the people at the party turn to look at us. 

"Betch, what have you done? Huh?"

"Do you think you suit me? Huh? A weak slave omega like you?"

"What's going on?" I could hear several people muttering to each other as they looked at us. 

William was still standing in before me; he was staring at me as if he wanted to kil me and skin me alive. 

Seeing this situation, Luna Delicy came over, "What's wrong, my dear?" 

She asked her favorite son, but William didn't answer; instead, he kept glared at me. There was something in his eyes that portrayed that he really wanted to murder me right now.

"William my baby, what happened?" Again, Luna Delicy repeated her question as she looked at me and his son in turn.

"Nothing, Mom, I just have business with this little betch," William replied as he pulled me forcefully out of the ballroom. 

"Come with me!"

"Where?!" I squealed as I hobbled behind him, but he did not answer me.

He dragged me, with all his might, roughly into another room where a door slammed shut. 

"We need to talk out!!" he shrieked.

His deadly gaze caused the cold sweat on my forehead, and my heart beating fast in my chest made me feel lightheaded. He didn't say anything to me. He just shoved me down into the plush leather chair in his private room.

"You can't be my mate. The Moon Goddess must have made a mistake!" He growled as he looked into my eyes. He bent down before me, narrowing the distance between us until I could feel his breath on the flesh of my face.

"A lowly omega slave like you does not deserve to be the mate of an alpha like me," he added with panting breath.

"I can't accept you. You're a useless piece of shet that needs to go..." he said again.

I was stunned, silent, and motionless. My heart seemed to stop as I heard all his words and insults. It felt like my blood had turned into ice water, and my throat started closing up with a strong sensation of choking as I tried so hard to keep my tears from falling over my cheeks. I was breathing shallowly, and I couldn't breathe properly.

"Reject me then If you don't desire me..." I said as I glared at him. Fearlessly, it's the only thing left to protect my self-esteem.

"You!" He gripped my neck and strangled me so tightly that I had difficulty breathing; I was trying to grab his arm to get him to let me free.

"Just reject me, William. You can reject me now!" I said between my short breaths.

I heard a knock come, and someone rushed to the room, it was William's mother, Luna Delicy.

"William, my dear, what's wrong? What happened?" Luna Delicy's voice sounded panicked.

"It's nothing, Mom. I'm fine," he responded without turning around to see his mother entering, still looking at me.

"William..." she started.

"Leave us, Mom," he commanded.

"What's going on, Will?" 

"Tell me!" Luna Delicy.

"Mom..." 

"Will, let go of her. You could kil her, and it's not good if she dies in your room!" Feeling unheard, Luna Delicy snapped at William, who then slowly stretched out his hand that was choking my neck.

"What's going on here? Why that dungeon girl here?!" Alpha Montgomery burst into the room, looking at the three of us in turn with puzzled faces. 

"I don't know, honey, William didn't say a word," 

"Dad, Mom, that moon goddess has given me this omega slave as my fate mate...." William said in a rough and heavy voice.

"This is a big insult to me, and I want to get rid of her. I don't want to see her in our palace anymore!" William took out a dagger from underneath the suit he was wearing.

"Stop that, William!" Alpha Montgomery shrieked.

William threw a quick glare at his father before putting back the dagger under his jacket. I could tell he was furious that his dad interrupted him.

Alpha Montgomery looked at me once again.

"You, dungeon girl!"

"Leave!" He shooed me away.

"But dad -" William snapped.

"Let me and your mom handle it; just listen to us and calm yourself down, okay?" 

**

I raced back to the dungeon, fighting back the tears that were about to burst out of my eyes. No, no, I can't cry. Don't show weakness; don't show him how much pain he caused me.

I opened the dungeon's gate to see the two guards standing right behind the gate.

"Is the event over? Why are you back already?" They asked.

"I'm not that interested in watching the event," I muttered as I walked past them into the dark hallway of the dungeon to the cell that had been my home since I was born into the world.

Luckily, my mother already sleeping. 

I gently pushed open the cell door before sitting on one of the benches inside. I covered my head with my hands, and I could no longer hold it all in the pain and humiliation. 

Tears were flowing freely now, my body trembling slightly with every sob that came out of my mouth. I didn't try to hold them back anymore.

My shoulders heaved, and I was unable to breathe properly. The pain felt too much for me to bear. I felt like knives were ripping me apart.

"Dungeon girl!" someone called me.

My sobbing stopped as I heard his step approaching.

"Alpha Montgomery asked you to come to his place," said someone I recognized as the head of household in the main palace.

I looked up at him, still with tears in my eyes. 

"Now?" I asked.

"Yes, now," he said clearly.

"Ok," I whispered as I got up, wiped my tears away with the sleeve of my shirt, and followed him.

Chapter 3
Mytira's POV

The head of the main palace household escorted me to the threshold of the twin doors and he knocked on them for me.

"You have come," Luna Delicy pulled open the door for me.

I was stunned for a moment in front of the door, my feet not stepping in immediately. My eyes went to the person who was now at the center of the room, glaring at me with a mocking gaze and a cunning smile.

"Come in, we have something to talk about," Luna Delicy pulled me in before she slammed the double doors shut.

"Sit down, Mytira," Alpha Montgomery said to me. 

He smiled slightly, an oddly friendly smile. As far as I know, Alpha Montgomery was an alpha who had always kept his distance from the servants, and he was not an alpha who was warm to his lowly wolves like me. 

I could say he was an arrogant and cruel alpha. And his kind smile at me only added to my creepiness at him.

I didn't reply, but instead stood still in front of the three people who were looking at me with a hint of a smile on each other's lips.

It was strange.

"Hey dungeon girl, sit your as down there, what's so hard?" William chirped, showing his white teeth.

"Come on, don't be shy!" Luna Delicy yanked me again and forced me to sit on the sofa and face Alpha Montgomery.

"Mytira, so, hmm, my son has told me that you are his fated mate," alpha Montgomery didn't seem to want to waste time, so he shot straight at his point.

I'm still silent. I don't want to react to anything before they explain the intention of summoning me.

"You must understand why I called you here, right?" He asked me, but I answered him with a shook head.

"You don't fit to be my son's mate, and neither do we want you to be Luna in our pack. Wouldn't it be hilarious if a girl of unknown origins, who's lived in a dungeon her whole life, suddenly became the pack's future Luna? Wouldn't that be..." 

"Inappropriate,"

"You do not deserve this honor, but..." Alpha Montgomery seemed to let out a long sigh.

"But I have a pretty good offer for you." 

"Darling, it's not an offer," Luna Delicy interjected.

"But rather an ultimatum," Luna Delicy continued as she looked at me sharply. She pursed her lips. Meanwhile, William, who was now standing behind them, was gazing at me with satisfaction. 

I felt a sense of dread.

"You must have heard about Alpha Goris from Crescent Snow Pack, right?" 

I nodded; who doesn't know that old pdophile alpha who likes to marry girls his granddaughter's age? He was a disgusting alpha. And everyone knew it. Everyone also knew that he had changed mates dozens of times as often as he changed his socks. 

When he no longer desired them, he would simply refuse, expel them from the pack, or even murder them if the first and second ways did not work.

"You know, isn't Alpha Goris a widower now?" 

"He has no mate, and the Crescent Snow Pack has no Luna at the moment." Luna Delicy flashed another sly smile.

I nodded; this time, I didn't know what had happened to his last mate and Luna.

"We just made a deal with Alpha Goris, and he has agreed to take you as his mate, and if within two years you can do a good job as his mate, then he will make you Luna." Alpha Montgomery stated.

I was stunned for a moment before I finally nodded in agreement, "Okay, I agree to your offer." 

At least I don't have to be here anymore. I can go with my mom.

"But please let me take my mom with me," I begged.

"Only when you become Luna, then you have the right to take your mother away from here." 

It was easy, and it seemed easy. I just needed to serve the sixty-five-year-old Alpha Goris. That was it, and if he were happy with me, then he would make me his Luna. 

"I agreed. When I become Luna, I will come and rescue my mother from this place." 

"In two days, Alpha Goris will pick you up, be ready."

"Okay, I get it," I said as calmly as I could.

"I am more than happy to accept your offer, Alpha, thank you for your generosity," I said to him as I bowed and smile broadly.

As I lift up my head, I could see the cynical and condescending smile on William's lips slowly fading. I don't know what he was thinking, but I definitely felt victorious at the moment.

"Is that all, Alpha?" I asked, breaking the silence.

"Yes, that's all," Alpha Montgomery replied, but his son quickly interjected.

"Hmm, I guess no," William interrupted.

"Actually, I wanted to ask you to clean my room, come Mytira, follow me to my room.." He grinned.

"Honey, you can ask her tomorrow. After all, tonight, you have failed to find your mate. Wouldn't it be a good time to go back to the event and talk to some of the alpha girls there? You can pick one of them to be your future Luna, right?" 

"I will definitely get my second mate, Mom. Take it easy," William said.

"And obviously, she is not an omega slave like her," 

"We've taken care of your problem, so don't make any more trouble," Alpha Montgomery said to William.

"Take it easy, Dad, trust me," William said.

"I just want her to clean up the stuff I brought from training. I have a lot of dirty clothes in my suitcase."

"Mytira, you heard that right? Now hurry up and follow my son and clean up his room!" Luna Delicy ordered, to which I simply replied with a nod.

I soon followed William to his room on the second floor of the palace.

---

"Come in," Willian said to me as soon as he opened the door to his room.

I looked at him for a while, trying to find an answer to my bad feeling. I sensed William was planning something nasty.

"I think I can clean your room without you having to accompany me, and I already know what to do. I've done this job hundreds of times," I stated without leaving his eyes.

William smiled, one corner of his lips pulled up.

"Congratulations," he said softly.

"Soon, you'll be marrying that stinky old man," he chuckled.

"That's the position you deserve, to be the betch that grandpa faks. You must be after his fortune, right?" William taunted me, but I didn't want to respond to him.

"A betch like you is more suited to be a wh0re for peophiles like Goris," 

"I can't work if you stay here. Can't you just leave me alone and let me do my job?" I said in a high tone. I could see Willian stunned as I snapped at him.

"What did you say? Who do you think you are? How dare you yell at me? Huh?!" 

He roughly pulled me into the room and closed the door, locking it.

"What are you doing?!" I got scared when I realized that William really locked his room.

"Open this door!" I screamed.

"I won't open this door, Mytira..." William hissed with a wide smile and devilish gaze. 

His body leaned close to mine as he held me tight against his chest. His hand caressed my cheek and traced the curve of my jawline. He was so close that I could feel his breath on my skin, making me want to push him off me, but that wasn't an option since he was holding me firmly against his chest.

"Let me go!" I screamed.

I growled. I tried to break free from William's restraints, but I was no match for him; he was too strong. 

He gave me no mercy; in fact, William seemed to enjoy watching me as I struggled to break free from him. He glared at me unblinkingly as he grinned.

"If you don't let me go, I'll scream!" I threatened.

"Just do it. No one will hear you. Everyone is at the event right now. The palace is empty. It's just you and me..."

"Why are you doing this to me? What did I do wrong?" 

"All you need to do is reject me, and it's over." I hissed in a half-begging voice. I couldn't possibly go the hard way since my strength was nothing compared to his.

"Fine, just let me reject you so you don't have to trouble yourself by rejecting me," I let out a long sigh before I finally said, "I, Mytira, reject you, Willian Montgomery, as my mate," I said loudly and confidently.

"I decline your rejection, Mytira," he hissed right into my left ear.

"I will not let you live a happy life. I vow to make you miserable, Mytira..." His blue irises turned red, and I knew that meant he was in the heat right now. This situation was not good for me since I was still his mate because he did not accept my rejection.

This is a red flag, I screamed to myself. I must do something.

I tried to push William as hard as I could with my legs. I had to keep my distance before he completely lost control, or even I could lose control. Tonight was the night of the peak full moon, and I was stuck with my mate, a crazy mate who didn't want to accept me but also didn't want to take my rejection.

Chapter 4
Mytira's Pov

I was trapped between the door and William's body, towering over me. I couldn't move and stop him. I struggled to control my erratic heartbeat as he leaned his lips closer to mine.

"Ashole, get away from me!" I screeched.

But I knew Wiliam wouldn't stop as I realized that William was in a state of heat, the smell of his body, the warmth of his body, and his howling breath. 

I could feel his arousal surge. 

And it was driving me crazy, too. No, I mustn't fall for it. I can't...

And suddenly, his lips ferociously devoured mine, his licks rough and brutalizing. He bit my lip to get in and then used his tongue inside my mouth when his other hand began to slip under my blouse.

His kiss was rough and punishing; he svcked my lips hard, his tongue pushed in, and his teeth bit my lips, hurting me to the point of making me bleed. I didn't stay silent; I retaliated by doing the same, biting his lips, and it worked because he then broke his kiss from me while cursing.

"Betch!" 

I looked at him through my blurry eyes and laughed at him.

"You deserve it," I chuckled between my tears. It was all I had left to maintain my pride. 

"I'll show you what I deserve!" William screeched angrily, his voice filled with menace, and his eyes revealed his burning hatred and outrage at me. 

William's hands seized me and tore off my tattered blouse.

I was too shocked by the action he did until the next second when I learned he had pulled me into his arms. His scent intoxicates me, making me forget that I should resist what he is currently trying to do. 

William blasted me again with his rough kisses until I had trouble breathing. I gasped as he swiped his tongue mercilessly. His lips colonize, muffling the curses and anger that overflow from my lips.

He didn't give me a chance to fight back. His hands worked quickly, ripping off the remnants of clothing still clinging to my skin. He released the latches that locked my brests together until both spongy things were free, and he savagely enjoyed them. He smothered my mouth until I couldn't cry out anymore. 

William was so wild, and his hand quickly ran through something between my thighs; I could no longer think clearly when he did it. I hated myself. I hated that the wolf inside me was taking pleasure in all his humiliating treatment of me.

It didn't take long for him to violently and passionately penetrated himself into me; he faked me on the cold floor of his room. He didn't even care about the blood oozing from the thing between my thihs.

Tension gathered in our center until. Finally, he could no longer hold back the explosion of his lust and spilled it all inside me.

"You're so good." He hissed with eyes sparkling but full of contempt and mockery. Once satisfied, he released himself, then put his pants back on, and left me lying at his feet, neked and holding back tears as I realized that I had given up something I had been holding on to.

With all the strength I had left, I stood up, grabbed my clothes, and quickly covered my neked body as best I could. William was still standing as he looked at me with satisfaction.

"Did you enjoy that? Your core is so tight and delicious..." He chuckled like a demon who had managed to make a human lose their purity.

I stood on my feet with my knees shaking, my eyes couldn't stop shedding tears, and I approached him, and without thinking, I landed a hard slap on the his cheek.

"You ashole!" I screamed with anger that had peaked at the top of my head, but this time, William didn't show anger; instead, a smile was drawn on his lips. He moved closer to erode the distance between us.

"Yeah, I'm an ashole, so what?" he chuckled.

"Now listen to me, Mytira..." 

"I, William Montgomery, the future alpha of the Glomarian Wood Pack, reject you, Mytira the Dungeon girl as my mate and future Luna of Glomarian Woods Pack...." 

I know this coming. I sense it.

This scum intentionally, rejecting me after successfully taking my innocence. After savoring my body, and the wild lust that arose because we- a few minutes ago were fate mates. 

I was stunned, still with tears that I couldn't hold back. I glared at him.

"What?! Don't say that you won't accept my rejection, now?" he cackle.

"That's why, as an omega, you can't be arrogant to us, the Alphas."

"Hmh, actually, I can consider accepting you as my mate but with some conditions-" he smiled widely, but I quickly snapped.

"I, Mytira the Dungeon girl, accept your rejection, William Montgomery. I hope you can live a happy life...." 

Suddenly, his smile faded as he heard my reply. And with the bit of energy I had left, I left his room. 

I wasn't going to wait to hear what kind of conditions he wanted to fulfill. I needed to leave, now, right now.

Before I exited, I stopped and threw out one last remark.

"And if ever you have the opportunity to take me, I won't hesitate to rip out your throat. I will always have my pride, William Montgomery."

---

As the morning came, I stirred from my slumber to the sound of the guards calling my name.

"Wake up, girl!" 

I still feel giddy because I could not sleep well.

Last night, after that incident, I hurried back to the dungeon after sneaking a quick wash in the maid’s bathroom at the palace.

Thankfully, my mother was still asleep. Because the last thing I wanted was for her to see me in the state I was in after last night’s breakdown.

"Alpha wanted to see you..." 

The guards, their voices echoing through the stone walls, informed me that our Alpha was looking for me.

Rising from my bed, I winced as I moved. The pain between my thihs stung me, but I stood before them with a fake smile while trying to hide the discomfort.

"What happened to you, Mytira?" one of them inquired, his brow furrowed in worry.

I simply shook my head, unwilling to divulge the details of the night before. I knew no one would believe me, and if they did, the blame would fall squarely on me. No one would question William, and I would be labeled as a betch who is trying to seduce the Alpha's son.

"Better make it quick. Alpha and Luna are waiting for you," the guard urged me.

Glancing back at my mother, whom the commotion had roused, I assured her I would return soon. 

"I will back, Mom..."

---

The guards led me to the Alpha's study room. 

When I arrived, the doorkeepers immediately opened the door to the alpha's study for me. And Luna Delicy, with an undeniable fake smile, greeted me.

"You've finally come; I have some news for you, Mytira..." She hissed with a strange, contemptuous look in her eyes.

"Sit," she shoved me to sit on the plush chair in front of Alpha Montgomery's desk while Alpha stared at me suspiciously.

"So, Mytira, I received bad news this morning..." Luna Delicy started.

"Alpha Goris, your future mate, passed away last night; he died while he was making love to one of the prstitutes in the brothel. Very sad, isn't it?" 

Luna Delicy's face was twisted in mock sorrow, though I could see the hint of a smirk lurking behind her facade. 

"So, we decided to find a new path for you." She said again, as if I no longer had the freedom to choose my own path in life.

---

Chapter 5
Mytira's POV 

I knew what was coming - my fate, hanging by a thread since I failed to seal the deal with that old alpha. He was my ticket to freedom, my only chance to rescue my mother from the dungeon, and now he's gone. 

"So, you get it, right?" Luna Delicy throws a grin at me.

"No wedding bells for you, which means our deal is off. And, unfortunately, my son can't stand the sight of you either. You've got to hit the road, pack your bags, and leave our pack," Luna Delicy explained, her eyes glittering with malice. 

It was like she was saying, "You're out, and good riddance."

"You're on your way out tonight - that's an order."

"Leave? Why should I leave? Your son rejected me already, and I've made peace with it. Isn't that the end of it?" I retorted a hint of bitterness in my tone.

"He doesn't want you around, plain and simple. So, off you go to another pack as a humble slave. Lucky for you, my friend requires new additions in his palace," she remarked casually, her icy gaze piercing me.

"And what about my mom? I can't just leave her behind," I pressed, my voice steady.

"Your mother stays put under our watchful eye in that dungeon. Don't worry; as long as you play by our rules, her life is safe," Luna Delicy stated callously, a cold smile on her lips.

"But..."

"You must remember that whatever comes out of my words is not an offer to you but an absolute command you must obey!!"

"Remember you are a slave, and the slave must bow at the knees of their masters." She snapped at me with a glare. 

"But I..."

"Mytira, shut your mouth, and don't talk back!" Luna Delicy shouted at me with bulging eyes and eyeballs that seemed to be popping out of her skull.

She was trying to intimidate me, but it worked, and I found myself shrinking in fear as she waved her hand dismissively at me. 

"Now get lost, don't screw up my morning. You're not needed anymore!"

"Leave now, dungeon girl!" Alpha Montgomery shouts at me.

I strolled towards the door without glancing back, as I could feel their gaze burning my back. As soon as the door shut behind me, tears rolled down my cheeks. My heart ached painfully, and I felt like crying my heart out. 

But no matter how hard I tried, I couldn't stop. I sobbed bitterly and wiped my tears away, my body trembling from the force of my emotions. 

"How nice it is to see you cry, the vain girl who pretended to be strong in the end crying over her bad luck of failing to become the mate of an alpha. What a pity..." And then, just luckily, I ran into that pain in the as Alpha's son, William, he stood on the staircase gazing at me. 

"Your dream of becoming Luna should be buried deep then. Congratulations anyway....on your failure." He said to me in a mocking tone.

He looked at me like he expected something from me.

I raised my head to look at him and said, "What do you want? Why are you always ruining my days." 

"Do you really think you can escape this life and still continue with your dreams?" He asked me in a mocking tone.

"That's none of your business, spoiled brat. What do you know about life?" I talked back as I threw a glare, deadly glare at him. 

I heard the footsteps of somebody else approaching us.

"Young Master, someone from the Crescent Snow Pack is here. He says he wanted to meet with Alpha and Luna." 

"Huh?" William turned to him and furrowed his brows.

"He said came on behalf of the late Alpha Goris."

Sensing that there was a good shot at escaping this unfortunate situation, I hurriedly left before William continued to throw insults and curses at me. I had to rush back to the dungeon to pack my things.

---

I had just finished packing all my clothes, not many. I only had a few pieces of shabby clothes. And those were clothes given to me by the daughter of a Beta who was kind enough to give them to me.

I had told my mother I was sent to be a temporary servant in another pack; I didn't want to see her sad. I didn't want her to know the hardships I was facing. 

"Mytira, Alpha is calling you," the prison guard told me.

So soon? It's only three in the afternoon, didn't they ask me to leave tonight? 

"Hurry up!" The guard hunted me down.

"I'm coming," I said and got up, leaving my mother in the cell alone.

The guards escorted me to the palace, but this time, they did not take me to the resting place of the alpha and his family. Instead, they took me to the conference room, a large room used by Alpha Montgomery to receive guests from other packs. 

Stepping inside, my attention was immediately drawn to a young man engaged in conversation with Alpha Montgomery and Luna Delicy. 

"Good afternoon..." I greeted, and that young man’s gaze suddenly turned towards me. He glared at me with furrowed brows.

"Is this the one?" he asked to the Alpha.

"Yeah, it's her..." Alpha Montgomery nodded.

“Mytira, meet Alpha Mateo Langdon, he is nephew of the late Alpha Goris.” As I approached them, Alpha Montgomery introduced me to him.

Alpha Mateo, with a cold, flat expression, extended his hand towards me. 

“I am Mateo ..." 

"Mytira," I said with a cold tone. I can feel that now, everyone's gaze was on me.

"Since I don't have much time, I'll just go straight ahead and tell you my intentions for coming here." 

The man rose from his seat. He glanced at Alpha Montgomery, Luna, and me in turn. Seriousness was clearly reflected on his face.

"I have come to take you to the Crescent Snow Pack, Mytira..." he hissed with a faint smile.

"Me?" 

"Yes, you, who else....you are the one my uncle desired.." 

"I will marry you," he said again with firmness.

"Marry?"

"I am replacing my late uncle to marry you, and I will be your groom," he explained.

"So, Mytira, will you be my chosen mate?" 

I stared at him in dazed disbelief. This was not a dream, was it?

"Be ready because I want our mating blessing to take place tonight. Isn't that right, Alpha, Luna?" Mateo turned and looked at Luna Delicy and Alpha Montgomery with a grin. Both nodded their heads awkwardly. I could see the fear in their eyes. I don't know what made the two people's arrogance fade before Mateo Langdon.

I could say this could be good, or it could be bad. 

"Is the offer I made you not enough? Why do you look so unexcited?" Mateo demanded as Alpha Montgomery quickly stood up and put on his all-too-obvious fake smile.

"No, no, of course, it would be my pleasure to prepare a mating party for you and the prospective mate of your choice, Alpha Mateo." 

"Good, I'd hate to overstay my time here, right Mytira?" Asked him as he looked at me sharply with a mysterious smile on his lips.

"But I..." 

"I don't like rejection, Mytira..." He glared at me.

"Trust me, you won't regret it." 

Without realizing it, I finally nodded and said yes to this arranged marriage and claimed him for me as his chosen mate.

---

I quickly returned to the dungeon to prepare everything as well as ask my mother's blessing for the path I had chosen.

But my steps were halted when I saw William standing in the hallway directed to the main gate towards the dungeon. He was crossing his arms in front of his chest, looking at me haughtily, and smiled slyly.

"You finally came by. I've been expecting you here for a long time," He strode to me briskly.

"What are you doing here? What do you want?" I shouted with the rage that seized me so firmly when I saw this bestard's face. Last night's events were instantly replayed in my head as I was facing him.

"Let me pass," I said as he barricaded my way, trying to block me.

"It's not that easy, Mytira..." William said with a giggle.

"I won't let you go so easily. After all, I promised to make your life a living hel..." He continued as he reached out and grabbed my jaw violently.

"What do you mean? The bond between us is already broken. And you're now free from this bond."

"Let's see if Alpha Goris's nephew will still accept you when he finds out that you are a betch who likes to seduce Alpha's son and is willing to be faked to be accepted as a mate." he threatened.

"What do you mean, William?!" 

"I intend to torture you and make you regret having belittled me."

He then pushed me hard against the wall and started kissing me. I tried pushing him off, but in vain, he wouldn't budge. William continued to kiss me as he roughly pressed himself onto me.

ad_creative_bodies:
Chapter 1 Kicked Out
The road was wet. It had been raining in Southdale for the whole day.

Wynter's backpack was disdainfully thrown out of the gate by the family's butler, Glen Clark.

"Ms. Quinnell, Mr. Yates will not come. Let me handle some things for him. Your biological parents are in the countryside, with the last name Quinnell. The Yates family had mistakenly thought you were their daughter. Now that Yvette has been found, we hope you will be sensible and stop contacting the Yates family," Glen said.

Taking out a card, Glen continued, "This is ten thousand dollars. Mr. Yates asked me to give it to you as compensation."

"I don't need it." Wynter didn't even look at it. She lifted her black bag.

Glen looked at the girl in front of him with annoyance. Wynter didn't even want the money. Was she trying to act like she was well off?

Tsk. Wynter didn't even consider whether the Yates family would still want her. The Yates family had already found their biological daughter. She was just a poor village girl. She couldn't climb up the social ladder.

"Well then, Ms. Quinnell. Please excuse yourself!" Glen slammed the gate shut.

Wynter ignored him. She left the Yates family with only a black bag. She had a straight and graceful posture.

She would leave exactly the way she first arrived here. Apart from the raindrops that made her look a bit disheveled, that is.

The people upstairs saw her leaving and laughed. They did not bother to hide their conduct so she could hear.

"She finally left."

"I was afraid she would stick to us and not return to the countryside."

Wynter paid no attention. There was a faint smile at the corner of her mouth.

Should she say that the Yates family didn't know how to appreciate good things?

Indeed, they didn't.

Wynter nonchalantly nibbled on her fruit candy. Her beautiful eyes, her long hair, and her pale face didn't make her look disheveled. Instead, it added a mysterious charm to her…

…

At the same time, in a courtyard in Kingbourne, the Quinnell family was holding a transnational meeting.

Fabian Quinnell sat at the top, his hand holding a dragon staff. His presence was imposing.

"So many years have passed. There's still no news about your sister?" Fabian asked his six grandsons.

The six sons of the richest man in Kingbourne, the Quinnell family, were all elites. When they were in the public eye, each one of them could cause a stir in their respective circles.

But today, they all looked dejected, with a hint of melancholy and longing in their eyes.

They had lost their seventh sister back then. She was just a little baby at that time, cute and lovely. She neither cried nor fussed.

18 years had passed, and they had been searching for her all this time. They lost the last clue in a small mountain village. They didn't know how she had been human trafficked. 

"Grandfather, we will continue to search. We will find her!"

Just then, a chubby man rushed in with documents and panted. "Mr. Quinnell! We found Ms. Quinnell!"

Fabian, who had always been calm, immediately stood up. His hands shook a bit.

"Where is she? Arrange for someone to bring her back immediately!" he said.

The man handed over the documents and said, "She's in Southdale. We are still confirming the exact location."

"Then, set out for Southdale!" Fabian replied in excitement. "Prepare the car!"

…

It was sunset in Southdale when Qynter was kicked out. She did not return to the countryside. Instead, after the rain stopped, she returned to her residence.

It was in a rather inconspicuous neighborhood. When she parked her car, someone greeted her, "Welcome back, Wynter."

"I'm back." Wynter smiled lightly.

The fruit seller handed her an apple and said, "I haven't seen you for half a month. No one has been looking after me. My hands tremble whenever I play chess."

Everyone in the Harmony Community knew Wynter. Some retired officials liked chatting with her while she consulted them. 

Their seemingly ordinary appearances should not fool anyone. Secrets surrounded them, such as the chess player who once competed nationally.

As for the rest of them, Wynter never investigated their identities. She lived here just for relaxation.
Chapter 2 She Hid Deeply
"Tomorrow, at the community square, I will give acupuncture treatments to everyone," Wynter calmly instructed. "Don't forget to brew the medication. Don't stay up late watching dramas. The TV show won't be going anywhere." 

During this time, the most popular show in the Harmony Community was some courtroom drama, and the elderly residents were getting a bit obsessed with it.

Wynter's reminder made them a bit guilty. She said, "We'll go to bed by ten from now on."

In the past, it would have been unimaginable that this group of elderly residents would listen to someone so obediently. Many of them had outstanding achievements, and even their identities were kept confidential.

The community's director, Dom Fisher, had been eagerly waiting for the genius doctor's return. Now, he finally breathed a sigh of relief and said, "Dr. Genius, I've been keeping an eye on your house. I didn't let anyone get close."

"Thank you for your hard work," Wynter said politely. She handed him some fruits.

Dom happily accepted and said, "It's not hard to do work for you, Dr. Genius. You won't be leaving again, will you?" These people were not easily impressed by a small community director like him.

"Yes." Wynter took the keys and said, "I won't be leaving anymore."

He said cheerfully, "That's great news! Dr. Genius, do tidy up. I won't bother you for now. If you need anything, just let me know."

Wynter nodded.

After Dom left, Wynter used the keys to open the lock. The lock looked quite old, and it was seemingly nothing special.

However, after she opened the first lock, an LCD keypad was in front of her.

"Would you like to enable iris recognition?"

Wynter replied casually, "Yes."

"Iris recognition is in progress. Please wait..."

"Iris recognition completed."

"Welcome home, master," a gentlemanly electronic voice announced. It had not been activated for a long time.

With a click, the iron gate opened automatically.

The interior instantly became bright.

On the two-meter-high bookshelf, there were medical books as well as various bottles and jars containing medicinal herbs. There were many potted plants in the living room, most of which were herbs, each labeled. In the center of the living room was a cool black and red motorcycle—the discontinued BMW Tomahawk.

Wynter walked over and took a bottle of mineral water from the fridge. She was about to take a sip and catch up on her drama.

Her phone, which was charging on the table, rang with its unique ringtone.

"Quinnell the Rich, wake up and take cases! Quinnell the Rich, wake up and take cases!"

When it rang the third time, Wynter pressed the button to answer, "Speak."

"Boss, there's a big case in Southdale. Are you interested?"

Wynter took a sip of water and said, "What kind of case?"

"The richest man in Kingbourne is looking for his missing granddaughter. He says she's in Southdale and easy to find. Just some simple work, and you'll get lots of money."

Wynter yawned and said, "Not interested."

"Wait! Boss, wait! There's something else you like!" The voice on the other end was very eager. "It's also a big case!"

Wynter lazily propped up her chin and said, "Go on."

"The Yarwood family from Sorzada City is looking for you. They've offered a reward of ten million dollars for a consultation fee. As long as someone provides information leading to you, there's also a reward. It's a lot of money!"

"That sincere?" Wynter didn't beat around the bush. She lightly tapped her phone. "Send me the information.  I'll take a look."

"Alright!"

The next moment, the floor-to-ceiling windows turned into a projection screen, displaying the information.

The Yardwood family was an ancient family that had existed for generations. They were never absent from protecting the country. In her memories, they used to live in the Homeland Security Estate.

In addition, the Yardwood family had sent invitations to many famous doctors for a one-week consultation period, with the venue at the local Caesar Hotel. The purpose was to see who had the ability to cure Dalton Yarwood, the head of the Yarwood family.

As for the description of the illness, it was very brief. It only mentioned that Dalton had been weak for many years, and it was not suitable to disclose details publicly.

It seemed like things weren't that simple. Wynter stretched her legs and said, "I'll take this case."
Chapter 3 Rescuing Someone on the Street
"Boss, you really do have a discerning eye! I'll prepare the money to pay the Yardwood family now!"

Wynter's gaze remained indifferent as she said, "No rush. I'll head to bed first and deal with it tomorrow."

Apart from making money, Wynter's biggest interest was treating various complicated diseases.

Cases like the one from the Yardwood family were quite good. In fact, she was the only one who could calmly face the arrival of the Yardwood family in Southville.

Looking around now, all the prestigious families of Southville were in a hurry. Even families like the Yates family were busy making connections just to get an invitation from the Yardwood family. 

Rumors were circulating even in the regular resident's circles, making this month particularly lively in Southville.

First, the richest man in Kingbourne was looking for his granddaughter, and now the Yardwood family had come for medical consultations.

Rumors had it that the legendary divine doctor, known as "Dr. Miracle," had appeared in Southville, which prompted the Yardwood family's visit.

There were many rumors about this "Dr. Miracle," but it was difficult to distinguish between truth and falsehood. 

With the Yardwood family's invitation, this "Dr. Miracle" might actually appear…

…

The next day, in the retired courtyard, Wynter still woke up late. Like any working person, she was reluctant to leave her refreshing little house and soft bed on a hot morning.

However, she had to earn money.

After washing her face, she went out with just a bag and without makeup. She grabbed a public bike to avoid traffic during the morning rush hour.

"Hello, Wynter. Heading out?"

"Umm... Yeah."

Everyone whom she passed greeted her. Wynter took a hotdog that Jacob gave her. She moved forward without a care. In no time, she blended into the traffic flow.

Half an hour later, at the renowned Caesar Hotel in Southville, the lobby and surrounding areas bustled with activity. The high-end cars in the entire Southville had gathered here.

In comparison, Wynter, riding a bicycle, looked particularly conspicuous.

As she arrived, even before she could park, the security guard, Micah, approached to drive her away.

"Go away. Where did you poor student come from? We are not open to the public today," Micah said.

Wynter propped up the bike with one leg, her gaze meeting his. Her tone was calm as she said, "I'm here to save someone."

"You? Here to save someone?" Micah burst into laughter. "I say, little girl, you're not that old, but you're quite good at bragging."

Wynter thought for a moment, brought up the invitation page on her phone, and said, "Please tell the people inside that Dr. Miracle has come to accept the invitation."

"Dr. Miracle? I'm also a divine doctor, then!" Micah scornfully glanced at her and said, "I've seen so many invitations, but I've never seen someone show it on their phone like you..." 

With that, he waved at Wynter dismissively and said, "Quickly leave. Don't block the way."

After he finished speaking, Micah went and happily opened the door for a luxury car. He said, "Madam Gibson, Ms. Yates, you've arrived. I'll quickly inform the people inside and prepare tea for you."

The people inside the luxury car only nodded through the window, not responding. Micah, however, was pleased, as if he had gotten a huge bonus.

As the luxury car drove past, through the car window, Yvette inside seemed to recognize Wynter and showed a hint of hesitation.

Madam Gibson asked, "Yvette, what's wrong?"

Yvette laughed softly and said, "Nothing."

Outside the car, Wynter's gaze remained indifferent. She walked decisively, with a playful hint at the corner of her mouth.

She never expected that someone who could decide life and death with just one needle would be looked down upon like this.

Indeed, those who experienced a loss of position and influence often faced indignity afterward. Wynter raised her lips slightly.

Wynter believed that treating an illness depended on fate, and she would not treat those who only sought personal gain.

Today, she would skip this consultation.

Pulling out her phone, Wynter was about to send a rejection message.

Suddenly, a scream came from the other side of the road.

"Oh no, someone fainted!"

In an instant, many people rushed over.

"Oh my God! It's a child!"

"His face is so pale..."

Hearing the commotion, Wynter didn't hesitate. She stopped the bike and walked quickly toward the crowd.

The little boy lying on the ground was only three or four years old. His forehead was wet as if he had sweated a lot.

Someone grabbed a person in a white coat and said, "Young man, you're a doctor, right? Quickly save this child!"

"No, I can't do so, ma'am. The family is not here, and I dare not take the initiative." The person in the white coat shook his head, showing disdain. "Besides, I don't treat just anyone."

Upon seeing this, Wynter directly pushed through the crowd. Her voice was clear, and her tone was professional as she said, "Please make way. Keep the airway open. The patient needs ventilation to cool down."

Perhaps it was her unquestionable presence, as the onlookers, after hearing her words, surprisingly did not question her.

When Wynter squatted down, her fingers reached for the child's neck.

The nearby lady, Patricia, became a bit anxious and asked, "Little girl, you're quite young. Can you do it?"
Chapter 4 Questioning Her Medical Skills?
"Yes, young lady, it's better to call 911 first. This child seems lost. I've been shouting for a while, but no one c​​ame," an old man said. He feared that the responsibility would fall on this girl if something went wrong.

Wynter quickly untied the little boy's suit and found a shady place nearby. "Ladies and gentlemen, rest assured, I have a medical license."

She pulled her backpack as she spoke to reveal a foldable small medical box. When the box opened, rows of silver needles and various surgical knives, long and short, were neatly arranged.

Wynter once again checked the boy's pulse.

"Stop!" The man in the white coat couldn't stand it anymore. He shouted loudly, "How can you randomly give the patient injections?"

Ignoring him, Wynter lowered her eyes. She counted the boy's pulse and heart rate.

The man in the white coat sneered, "I am Luke Johnson, a student from Sacred Heart Medical University, and under Madam Gibson's guidance. I'm not an ordinary commoner. You say you have a medical license? How old are you?"

Wynter remained indifferent. She focused on the little boy, disinfecting the needles.

"I'm talking to you!" It was Luke's first time being ignored. "Even the old man knows to call 911. Don't you understand?"

Wynter knelt on one knee, her presence both sharp and cold. "Just standing by while waiting for 911? Delaying emergency treatment? Is that how your teacher taught you?"

"Who said just to stand by and wait for 911?" Luke was irritated, disdainfully retorting, "You're the one delaying emergency treatment now. Taking out needles to show off. You better put away your pseudo-science of traditional medicine. Let me perform CPR for the patient."

Upon hearing this, Wynter glanced at him, her gaze extremely cold.

Who would have thought such a pretty girl could be so unyielding?

"He has heatstroke. What are you doing with CPR?" Wynter pressed the boy's fingers. There was a chill in her voice when she said, "Incompetent doctor."

Luke exploded. "Who are you calling an incompetent doctor? Do you know who my mentor is?"

He had just returned from abroad with Madam Gibson and awards. This little girl dared to question his medical skills!

"I'm not interested in knowing." Wynter disinfected the needles, continuing her actions seamlessly. "Step aside."

Luke's eyes were red with anger. "I won't compare skills with a traditional medicine swindler like you. His lips are purple. It's obviously a heart problem..."

"Myocardial hypoxia and ischemia can stimulate respiratory function, leading to purple lips." Wynter met his gaze, her eyes icy. "However, heatstroke can also cause purple lips. The difference lies in his stable and moderate pulse. Moreover, his lip lines are dry, clearly indicating prolonged exposure to high temperatures. You don't even observe these medical signs, and you call yourself a student of Sacred Heart Medical University?"

"Yes, we should first observe medical signs. I've also learned that before," someone chimed in.

Others sneered. "This student from Sacred Heart Medical University doesn't seem that great."

"I still think the girl is reliable. I can tell she's professional just by observing her pulse reading."

Luke couldn't bear the humiliation. "Fine, even if he has heatstroke, can your few needles cure him? Then, what's the use of us medical students?"

"You can only speak for yourself, not for all medical students." Wynter's eyes were cold. "I'll say it again: step aside."

She despised two types of people the most in her life: those who belittled the legacy of traditional medicine and those incompetent doctors who delayed her efforts to save lives.

"Fine, I'll step aside. I want to see how capable this little girl is." Luke sneered, folding his arms. "If your needles can cure him, I'll kneel down and call you a genius!"

"I'll wait for that 'genius' from you," Wynter said, facing the light. She then probed with precision and swiftly lifted her hand!
Chapter 5 Saving a Life with a Single Needle!
The first needle was pierced.

Anthony immediately furrowed his brows, struggling as if regaining consciousness. Even the small wrinkles on his forehead tightened.

The crowd exclaimed, "He's waking up!"

Luke was dumbfounded, his face turning pale green. "How is this possible..."

How did she manage it? Just one needle and the person was conscious again?

Wynter raised her hand again, her eyes clear and calm. She pierced the second needle into his EX-UE 11 point. It was a quick stab followed by bloodletting.

Instantaneously, Anthony opened his eyes. A pair of round, bright eyes with unnaturally long eyelashes stared quietly at Wynter. His face was pale.

Everyone stared with widened eyes.

Patricia couldn't believe it. "Little girl, you just casually pierced two needles, and he's healed?"

Wynter gently pressed down on the needle puncture site, making sure the bleeding was sufficient. Then, she used a sterilized cotton ball to apply pressure to stop the bleeding. "Ma'am, it's not about randomly piercing two needles. The EX-UE 11 points and fingertips have the effect of clearing heat and awakening one's vitality. His condition was caused by excessive heat, and acupuncture can treat high fever."

"What you said sounds so convincing." Luke sneered. "This little boy hasn't spoken since just now. Who knows if the needle you just used caused some aftereffects?"

Patricia was puzzled. "This boy is awake now. Why are you talking about aftereffects? Young man, aren't you going to apologize?"

"This has nothing to do with you." Luke glanced at her and suddenly laughed. "I get it now. You're in cahoots. One lures people, and the other fakes an accident. This is a collective scam. I knew you traditional medicine folks were all no good."

Wynter's eyes suddenly turned cold after she heard this. She was about to raise her hand.

Unexpectedly, Anthony spoke up, his sickly voice cold. "Traditional medicine has been a national treasure since ancient times. Sir, you're not good at medicine. You should read more books in the future."

"You..." Luke was suddenly speechless. He had just said that the boy hadn't been cured. Now, the boy spoke up and even criticized him. Wasn't this a blatant slap in the face?

Patricia laughed so hard she almost fell over. "You're from Sacred Heart Medical University, but you're being told to study more."

"There's no point talking with you people from the lower class." Luke sneered, his words full of arrogance. "A bunch of poor people."

Swoosh! Wynter flicked a silver needle from her hand, brushing past his cheek and piercing straight into the nearby tree. 

The viciousness of her move left Luke momentarily frozen, his legs even feeling a bit weak.

However, Wynter smiled, her elegance deliberate and unhurried. "Have you forgotten something?"

Though she was a young girl, the hostility emanating from her overwhelmed everyone in the vicinity.

Struggling to maintain composure, Luke asked, "What did I forget?"

"An apology. Call me 'genius'." Wynter lightly tapped her phone, exuding a bewitching beauty.

Defiant, Luke retorted, "Who hasn't made a diagnostic error? I don't have time to argue with a half-baked young traditional medicine practitioner like you."

Unable to bear it any longer, Patricia interjected, "Is this all? Are you still Madam Gibson's disciple? You lost to a young girl. Yet, you won't even apologize? This medical ethics of yours..."

"What's wrong with my medical ethics?" Luke shamelessly replied. "Who can testify to what I said just now? Your entire life's earnings wouldn't be enough to cover Madam Gibson's consultation fees. It's your fortune that I'm offering free consultations. You guys have short lives and are criticizing me. You should think twice about where you are."

Trembling with anger, Patricia exclaimed, "Y-You!"

Luke gave a cold snort, a look of disdain on his face. He looked like he wanted to say, "What can you do to me?" 

In a society governed by the rule of law, he didn't believe this unconventional young traditional medicine practitioner would dare to lay her hands on him.

"You really are a poor country bumpkin! Just take your stuff and leave!"

She looked at the man emotionlessly, remembering how he had sucked up to her a few days ago.

"I knew you're a materialistic man. It's a good thing I never fell in love with you," Wynter Quinnell said coldly while grabbing the man by his collar. "You'd better remember what you said today. Remember, you need to pay the price for provoking me."
